events.message: The policyholder reported an auto accident involving their vehicle on the downtown highway resulting in front bumper damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident based on initial details of the collision.
A claims agent specializing in auto collisions was assigned to handle the case promptly.
The claimant received official acknowledgment of the submitted auto accident claim with reference number.
Request sent for photos of the damaged car, police report, and witness statements to proceed with investigation.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including police report and multiple photographs of the collision damage.
The investigation into the circumstances of the auto accident began with review of submitted evidence and statements.
Conclusion of the investigation confirmed claimant’s version and assessed vehicle damage consistent with a rear-end collision.
A settlement offer covering repairs for the damaged vehicle and related expenses was proposed to the claimant.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with timely handling and clarity of the proposed settlement terms.
The claim approval was finalized based on investigation results and claimant agreement to proposed settlement amount.
Settlement payment was issued to the claimant’s bank account to cover auto repair costs and deductible.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following successful payment and no further customer inquiries.
All case files and documentation for the auto accident claim were archived securely for future reference.
